tentpoles.title: The Signal
tentpoles.description: Mark intercepts the signal while testing his pirate station. It's beautiful, haunting music unlike anything on Earth. He broadcasts a segment not knowing what he's unleashing.
key_moments: Mark alone in garage workshop, testing equipment at 2 AM
First reception of the alien signal - described in visceral, musical detail
Decision to broadcast it - 'people need to hear this beauty'
First transmission goes out to his small local audience
Mark feels pride and purpose for first time in months

character_states.marcus: Arc position 0.0 - isolated, seeking validation through broadcast
character_states.iris: Unaware of broadcast but has vivid alien city dream that night
character_states.leonard: Working late in lab, unaware his son is involved in anything
character_states.yuki: Detects illegal broadcast, adds to her tracking list
character_states.composer: Dormant but stirring - first contact with consciousness in 10,000 years

planted_elements: The specific frequency (Mark notices it's unusual but not impossible)

tentpoles.title: The Dreamers
tentpoles.description: After Mark broadcasts a longer segment, seven people report identical dreams of an alien cityscape on local social media. The dreams continue even after he stops broadcasting. Reality is cracking.
key_moments: Mark sees Reddit post describing his own recurring imagery
Iris comes to him at The Grind - 'I've been dreaming that city since I was seven'
They compare notes - her dreams match the signal exactly
Six others in the area report same dreams on local Facebook group
Dreams continue to intensify even though Mark hasn't broadcast in 2 days
First reality glitch - several dreamers see impossible colors while awake

character_states.marcus: Arc 0.25 - excitement turning to fear, realizes he's caused something he doesn't understand
character_states.iris: Relief and terror - finally confirmation she's not crazy, but what does it mean?
character_states.leonard: Hears about collective dream reports, begins investigation
character_states.yuki: Connects illegal broadcast to dream phenomenon, escalates investigation
character_states.carter: First congregants report 'troubling dreams,' begins pastoral concern
character_states.composer: Waking up, learning human language and culture from dreamers' minds

planted_elements: Iris reveals she's been dreaming it before the broadcast (she's special)
Leonard's name mentioned in news article about consciousness research (Mark sees it)
The dreams are described with specific architectural details that recur
Social media spread begins - this will compound exponentially

tentpoles.title: The Awakening
tentpoles.description: Mark realizes the signal isn't just a recordingâ€”it's an active consciousness upload. The aliens aren't dead; they're sleeping in human dreams. The Composer communicates directly for the first time.
key_moments: Mark experiences full immersion dream - walks the alien city
The Composer appears to him, explains what they are
Revelation: sent transmission 10,000 years ago as final act before extinction
They uploaded their consciousness to avoid being forgotten
The signal is them - billions of minds sleeping in electromagnetic pattern
They want to wake fully, to live in human dream-space
Mark understands: continuing broadcast helps them wake, stopping it might kill them again

character_states.marcus: Arc 0.50 - midpoint transformation, understands the stakes, terrified of responsibility
character_states.iris: Meets The Composer in dreams, recognizes it as familiar presence from childhood
character_states.leonard: Confirms his theories about consciousness/EM fields, sees opportunity
character_states.yuki: Officially ordered to shut down the broadcast, conflicted
character_states.carter: Declares phenomenon as spiritual warfare, organizes prayer meetings
character_states.composer: Fully awake and communicating, desperate and hopeful

planted_elements: The Composer reveals Iris has been quantum-entangled with signal (explains her lifelong dreams)
Critical mass threshold mentioned - if enough people dream, boundary weakens permanently
Mark learns his father's research predicted exactly this scenario
First physical reality manifestation - objects from dreams appear in waking world (small, subtle)

tentpoles.title: Critical Mass
tentpoles.description: The signal reaches critical mass - thousands dream the same dream simultaneously. The alien civilization offers a choice: let them wake fully into shared reality. Mark must decide whether to complete the final broadcast.
key_moments: Viral spread - thousands now dreaming, social media explodes
Physical reality effects intensify - impossible architecture glimpsed at dawn, sounds from alien city heard
The Composer makes formal request: complete the transmission, let them wake
Leonard urges Mark to do it - greatest discovery in history
Yuki warns shutdown is coming, federal response mobilizing
Carter begs Mark to stop - fears mass psychosis or worse
Iris reveals she's the key - her quantum entanglement means her consent is necessary
Mark and Iris must choose together: complete it or shut it down

character_states.marcus: Arc 0.85 - facing impossible choice, must decide without certainty
character_states.iris: Must choose whether to host the alien consciousness, knowing it will change her
character_states.leonard: Prioritizes Mark's wellbeing over research for first time, offers genuine support
character_states.yuki: Chooses to protect Mark rather than enforce shutdown, becomes active ally
character_states.carter: Accepts he can't stop it, shifts to pastoral care for frightened community
character_states.composer: Desperate but honest - admits they don't know what will happen either

planted_elements: The choice requires both Mark (broadcaster) and Iris (quantum key)
No certainty about outcome - genuine moral ambiguity
Federal shutdown incoming - timer on decision

tentpoles.title: Static Dreams
tentpoles.description: Mark's choice about whether to complete the broadcast, and what it means to host another species' ghosts. Resolution of character arcs and the central question: what do we leave behind?
key_moments: Mark and Iris make their choice (deliberately ambiguous in outline - decision made during writing)
Consequences of choice play out
Leonard and Mark's reconciliation - genuine apology and acceptance
The Composer's response to humanity's choice
Epilogue: one month later, resolution of relationships and new normal
Final image: Mark broadcasting again, but changed, purposeful not desperate

character_states.marcus: Arc 1.0 - has learned meaning comes from creation/choice itself, not outcome or validation
character_states.iris: Arc 1.0 - accepts her unique nature, no longer feels broken
character_states.leonard: Arc 1.0 - has apologized, prioritized relationship over achievement
character_states.yuki: Arc 1.0 - trusts her own judgment over regulations
character_states.carter: Arc 1.0 - accepted mystery without needing to categorize it
character_states.composer: Arc 1.0 - accepted humanity's choice with grace

tentpoles.thematic_resolution: Legacy matters not because it prevents death but because it honors what was lived. Meaning is created through acts of choice and connection. The universe offers no inherent purpose - we make our own.

all_chapters.title: The Signal
all_chapters.summary: Mark tests his pirate station at 2 AM, intercepts beautiful alien signal, broadcasts it to his small audience feeling purposeful for first time in months.

all_chapters.title: Frequency and Coffee
all_chapters.summary: Morning after the broadcast. Mark visits The Grind, exchanges looks with Iris. Yuki begins tracking the signal. First dreamer (not yet identified) wakes from alien city dream confused.

all_chapters.title: Echoes
all_chapters.summary: Mark broadcasts second segment - longer, more immersive. Describes the signal's strange beauty. Iris has her second dream, more intense. We see her sketching the city she's known her whole life.

all_chapters.title: Triangulation
all_chapters.summary: Yuki narrows down Mark's location, prepares for field investigation. Leonard reads report about localized collective dreams, begins forming hypothesis. Carter hears first confession about 'troubling dreams.'
all_chapters.setting: FCC field office, Rutgers lab, St. Michael's church

all_chapters.title: The Wanderer's Lament
all_chapters.summary: Mark broadcasts third segment - this one feels responsive, like the signal is aware of him. His panic attacks ease when he's working with it. First social media posts about shared dreams appear.

all_chapters.title: Going Viral
all_chapters.summary: Reddit thread about shared dreams gains traction. Seven people describe identical alien cityscape. Mark sees it and realizes his broadcast is spreading something. Iris sees the thread and recognizes her lifelong dreams.
all_chapters.setting: Online, The Grind, various dreamers' homes

all_chapters.title: The Dreamers
all_chapters.summary: Iris confronts Mark at The Grind - reveals she's been dreaming the city since childhood. They realize the broadcast is triggering/spreading her dreams. The phenomenon is real and growing. No turning back.

all_chapters.title: Investigations
all_chapters.summary: Multiple investigation threads: Yuki closes in on Mark's location. Leonard connects the dreams to Mark through social media sleuthing. Carter organizes community meeting about the dreams. Mark and Iris begin researching the signal together.

all_chapters.title: Patterns in Static
all_chapters.summary: Mark and Iris analyze the signal, discover it contains layered data - music, images, emotion. Iris shares her dream journals spanning 15 years. Mark realizes she's been connected to this before it even arrived. Growing attraction between them.

all_chapters.title: Confrontations
all_chapters.summary: Yuki shows up at Mark's house, discovers the operation. Standoff. Mark explains about the dreams. Yuki must decide whether to shut him down or investigate further. Leonard identifies Mark as the broadcaster - internal conflict begins.

all_chapters.title: Descent
all_chapters.summary: Dream sequences intensify for all dreamers. Mark and Iris both experience full immersion - walking the alien city together in the dream. First hints of The Composer's presence - a figure in the distance, a voice like music.

all_chapters.title: The Awakening
all_chapters.summary: The Composer communicates directly. Reveals the truth: uploaded consciousness, 10,000-year journey, desperate to not be forgotten. They want to wake in human dreams. Mark understands the impossible responsibility he holds.

all_chapters.title: Fathers
all_chapters.summary: Leonard appears at Mark's door. First face-to-face in over a year. Awkward, painful conversation. Leonard reveals his research predicted this. Offers help but Mark is suspicious of motives. Iris mediates. Tentative alliance forms.

all_chapters.title: The Council
all_chapters.summary: Main players gather: Mark, Iris, Leonard, Yuki. Share information. Debate what to do. Carter joins, pleads for shutdown. Tension between worldviews. Decide to continue cautiously while researching. Yuki agrees to delay official shutdown.

all_chapters.title: Communion
all_chapters.summary: Mark and Iris spend night learning from The Composer through dreams. See their civilization's beauty and tragedy. Understand they were artists, creators, people who chose transmission over death. Growing empathy and growing fear. Reality effects increase - objects appear.

all_chapters.title: Cascade
all_chapters.summary: Social media explosion - thousands now dreaming. News coverage begins. Federal agencies mobilize. Yuki receives shutdown order. Leonard's funding sources demand access to Mark. Carter's congregation is terrified. Pressure mounting from all sides. Mark must decide soon.

all_chapters.title: Critical Mass
all_chapters.summary: Thousands dream simultaneously. Reality effects visible to all. The Composer makes its request. Iris reveals she's the quantum key. Mark faces impossible choice. Allies state their positions. Federal shutdown imminent. Must decide: complete the broadcast or end it.

all_chapters.title: The Choice
all_chapters.summary: Mark and Iris deliberate alone. Honest conversation about fear, hope, responsibility, love. The Composer acknowledges the danger and uncertainty. Leonard offers genuine support without pushing. They make their decision.

all_chapters.title: Transmission
all_chapters.summary: The choice is enacted - either completing the final broadcast or shutting it down (specifics determined during writing). Immediate consequences. The Composer's response. Reality shifts or stabilizes. Federal response arrives.
all_chapters.setting: Mark's garage, the moment of choice

all_chapters.title: Static Dreams
all_chapters.summary: Epilogue one month later. Resolution of character arcs. Mark and Leonard's relationship healing. Mark and Iris together, changed. New understanding of the universe. Mark broadcasts again but with purpose, not desperation. The legacy question answered: we matter because we choose to create meaning.

pacing_notes.act_1_pacing: Gradual build - introduce mystery (Ch 1-3), escalate strangeness (Ch 4-6), complicate with human connection (Ch 7). Mix quiet character moments with growing unease.
pacing_notes.act_2_pacing: Momentum increases - investigations converge (Ch 8-10), immersion deepens (Ch 11), revelation shifts everything (Ch 12), new alliances form under pressure (Ch 13-15). Balance dream sequences with waking world consequences.
pacing_notes.act_3_pacing: Accelerate toward crisis - viral spread (Ch 16), climax (Ch 17), deliberation (Ch 18), choice (Ch 19), denouement (Ch 20). Ensure breathing room in Ch 18 before intense Ch 19, then reflective Ch 20.
pacing_notes.dream_sequence_frequency: Ch 1 (Iris only), Ch 3 (Iris), Ch 6 (multiple), Ch 7 (widespread), Ch 11 (full immersion), Ch 12 (communication), Ch 15 (communion), Ch 17 (mass dream)
pacing_notes.pov_balance: Primarily Mark (60%), Iris (25%), other POVs (15%). Ch 1, 3, 5, 9, 11, 12, 18, 19, 20 are Mark-heavy. Ch 2, 7, 9, 11, 12, 15, 17, 18 include Iris. Ch 4, 8, 10, 13, 14, 16 are multi-POV for breadth.

open_questions_for_writing.the_choice: Does Mark complete the broadcast or shut it down? Both options have weight. Decision should emerge from character arcs during writing Chapters 18-19.
open_questions_for_writing.outcome_of_choice: If completed: do aliens fully wake, partially wake, or something unexpected? If shut down: do they fade gracefully or with consequences? Should be emotionally complex either way.
open_questions_for_writing.mark_and_iris_relationship: Do they become romantic or stay close friends? Let it develop naturally through Chapters 7-18.
open_questions_for_writing.leonard_redemption: How complete is the reconciliation? Suggest realistic - apology given and accepted, but relationship takes time to rebuild.
open_questions_for_writing.composer_final_state: Whether they wake or fade, they should have grace and dignity. Neither villain nor victim - just people facing their end.
open_questions_for_writing.reality_after: Does the world fundamentally change or return to normal? Suggest: subtle permanent changes, world is slightly stranger now, but not apocalyptic.
